chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin R. Giebel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: paid in full from defendant's bond posted.

03:02 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin R. Giebel in court, in custody. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court for Benjamin R. Giebel. Calling 22CF7 & 22CF57. Schiek statement to agreement. State moves to dismiss and read in 22CF7 and counts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9 & 10 in 22CF57. Granted. Plea Questionnaire has been filed. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Both parties request PSI. Court orders PSI due by August 3, 2022 - author does not need to be present at sentencing. Bond is revoked - defendant is remanded. adj. 03:12 PM
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:33  AM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin R. Giebel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court for Benjamin R. Giebel. 
Calling 222cf57 and 22cf7.
Burns statement to motion to modify in 22cf57.  Schiek statement.  Burns further statement. 
Court statement to bond forfeiture in 22cf7 -no objection was filed.  Court has not yet signed order for forfeiture.  Court statement to bond motion - Court denies motion to modify and continues the $50,000 as ordered.

3:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin R. Giebel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court for Benjamin R. Giebel. 
Calling 22cf7and 22cf57.

In receipt of information, waive reading - not guilty plea.

Burns statement to motion to modify bond in 22cf57.  Pfeifer statement.  Court statement - Court denies motion to modify, bail continued as set.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin R. Giebel in court. Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court for Benjamin R. Giebel. Calling 22CF7 & 22CF57. Burns states 22CF57 is a waiver - 22CF57 will be going. Defendant waives preliminary hearing in 22CF57. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Investigator Chris Coniglio/sworn/direct by Schiek/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Schiek/cross by Burns/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause exists in 22CF7 and binds Defendant over. Schiek would like another arraignment date. Bond continued. adj. 02:19 PM
Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

11:31 AM Defendant Benjamin R. Giebel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mary L. Roth Burns in court for Benjamin R. Giebel.  Trackiing along is 22CF07 and 22CF57. Court goes over record and notes was just assigned to this case.  Atty Burns statement to bond - states mother is willing to sign a high signature bond and asks for such with a lower cash component and plan is to get defendant into treatment. Atty Schiek statement  Atty Schiek statement to bond and notes defendant was releases on $5000.00 cash bond and picked up a new conviction and would still like a high cash bond and feels this is more than a treatment case.  Court statement -states treatment would benefit defendant but defendant violated bond two months after money was posted on his behalf.  Motion to Modify Bond is denied.  Court sets for Preliminary Hearing for April 8th at 2:00 p.m. for both cases 22CF7 along with 22CF57. adj: 11:42 a.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
